config.question: The Crédit Mobilier affair was typical of what aspect of Grant’s presidency?

answer_3.response: Consider This: It involved a construction company that actually served as a fraudulent device for siphoning off profits that should have gone to the stockholders of the Union Pacific Railroad, which had received massive federal land grants. While there is no evidence Grant benefited from the deeds of the numerous bad actors in his administration, he failed to take action in these cases and participated in covering up their crimes. See L.O. 16.3 Why did Reconstruction end?
